doc.abstracts: This Annual Report, covering July 1, 1996 to June 30, 1997, chronicles a year of renewal at the World Bank. Strengthening partnerships and getting results in serving the poorest people in the world are two recurring themes running through the report. These two objectives are illustrated in the strengthened working relationship being forged between management and staff and the Executive Directors. One of the year's most significant achievements was the initiative to address the debt of the heavily indebted poor countries (HIPCs), which combines powerful partnerships to meet new needs, using nonlending and lending services with funding drawn from the Bank as well as other partners. Another was the Executive Board's unanimous approval of Strategic Compact in March 1997. The board will have an integral role in monitoring the Strategic Compact. This investment in changes will lead to much stronger and cost-effective institution in the future, and is an important step in further strengthening the relationship between the Bank and its shareholders.
